newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Sept 16.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Sept 16.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Merrill Lynch & Co Inc published a list of 17 global bank stocks it said were the top picks of its international team of analysts. In Australia Merrill Lynch said its pick was National Australia Bank Ltd, which it said has a consistent record of cost control, management of credit quality, and leadership in systems and product development.

FOXTEL, the Australian pay television joint venture between The News Corp Ltd and state-owned phone company Telstra Corp Ltd, said it made a A$165 million maiden pre-tax loss for the year ended June 30.
Orion Resources posted a year net loss of A$13.75 million on Friday from its A$6.08 million profit the previous year.

The A$78.09 million annual net loss reported by Hoyts Cinemas Group was due to large restructuring charges, a corporate source told Reuters late on Friday. The source, who was involved in the company's float last month, said the prospectus did not forecast net earnings for 1995/96. He said, however, that profit before interest and tax result was in line with the prospectus at about A$49.3 million.
Metway Bank Ltd's new chief executive Greg Moynihan says Queensland mega-bank that combines Metway, Suncorp and the Queensland Industry Development Corp (QIDC) will be open for business in December.
Primac Holdings Ltd said on Monday that IAMA Ltd's takeover bid announced on Friday of nine IAMA shares for every 10 Primac shares appeared to be totally inadequate.
